intro: Seseli rigidum var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate rigid seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its botanical interest. This variety is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
